attributes.action: Instruct the Minister of Health to investigate the need for any increased charges now being proposed by Patientline the suppliers of telephone and TV and Internet services used by patients in NHS Hospitals
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The annoucement made that telephone charges imposed by Patientline in NHS Hospitals will increase by 160% simply is not acceptable, on the excuse that the company responsible needs to recoup investment made in supplying the equipment.

Both patients and relatives will suffer at a time when they need to be able to keep in touch when they are needing to be able to communicate easily without fear of running up a huge telephone bill at the behest of Patientline who are able to demand what charges they like.

This needs to be stopped

rejection.details:
This petition overlaps with several in existence already -
http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/Fair-deal-phones/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
